isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB - TILT: 9800 - CAB TILTING - PROCEDURE

svcprocinfo.para: The cab tilt pump has been conveniently located on the right rear side of the chassis to facilitate easy operation and to keep the operator away from traffic flow. A two cylinder lift system reduces cab twist loads during raising and lowering.

warning.para: Failure to follow proper procedures may result in serious personal injury, death or property damage.

caution.para: To prevent possible cab nosing over, do not remove rear wheels or reduce weight on rear of chassis while cab is at full tilt position.

item.para: Park vehicle on level surface so there will be a minimum of frame twist and block the wheels.
Place transmission in neutral, set parking brake and shut off engine.
Remove or secure loose objects inside of cab and sleeper compartment.
Close cab doors and storage compartment doors.

caution.para: Provide sufficient cab clearance in front and above the cab before raising cab. Cab will free fall to fully tilted position when raised past the balance point ( Item 3, Figure 80). To stop the cab free fall, move lift control lever ( Item 3, Figure 81) to the "LOWER" position.

note.para:
If the cab has to be raised mechanically, refer to LIFT CAB MECHANICALLY
.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Full Tilt
svcsubproc.para: The mechanical hydraulic lift system provides 72.5 degrees cab tilt angle for access to the engine for routine maintenance. A optional cab tilt air assist system is also available.

step1.para: Place cab lift control lever in "RAISE" position ( Item 3, Figure 81).

Insert pump handle into pump handle receptacle ( Item 1, Figure 81), manually pump to raise cab, or if equipped with air assist, press control button ( Item 4, Figure 81) on air pump motor ( Item 6, Figure 81) to operate pump.

note.para: If vehicle is equipped with air assist pump motor and the air system does not have enough air pressure to lift the cab, there is an external air fitting on the air pump motor ( Item 5, Figure 81). Air from another source can be fed into the system to operate the air pump motor.

step1.para: At full tilt, engage cylinder safety stop ( Item 1, Figure 82).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Partial Tilt
svcsubproc.para: When tilting cab partially, ALWAYS support cab with alternate safety prop ( Item 2, Figure 83), such as a piece of wood 4 x 4 or a 1 1/2 inch or larger diameter steel pipe cut to a suitable length. Place alternate safety prop into cab latch pad ( Item 3, Figure 83) and into cab tunnel area in cab back panel ( Item 1, Figure 83). Be sure that alternate safety prop is securely seated at both ends. Also be careful not to place safety prop end that fits into cab floor area on any of the air and hydraulic lines that are routed in that area. Carefully lower cab slightly, just to have a small amount of pressure on safety prop to hold prop in position. Then put cab tilt lift control lever ( Item 3, Figure 81) to RAISE position and pump handle to the point where cab starts to lift.

svcsubproc.title: Lower Cab

step1.para: Be sure transmission shift lever is in neutral position and engine is shut off.

Return cab cylinder safety stop ( Item 2, Figure 84) to its traveling position and secure in place with safety stop retainer ( Item 1, Figure 84). If cylinder safety stop is stuck on the cylinder, raise cab slightly to release cylinder safety stop.

svcsubproc.para: If cab was at full tilt position, while lowering cab, be sure transmission shift lever clears cab opening or damage could occur to the shift lever.
If cab was partially raised, remove alternate safety prop ( Item 2, Figure 83) by raising cab slightly to release tension on alternate safety prop and remove prop.

step1.para: Place pump lift control lever ( Item 3, Figure 81) in LOWER position and manually pump cab down against rear cab latch pads ( Figure 88). Visually inspect latch hooks ( Figure 89) to be sure they are fully engaged.
After cab is lowered and latched, place pump lift control lever ( Item 3, Figure 81) in RAISE position momentarily and then return to LOWER position.

svcsubproc.title: Special Latching Instructions
svcsubproc.para:
If both latches do not latch, recycle by raising cab a few inches and then pump down. If latches still do not latch, refer to TROUBLESHOOTING
.
If cab does not raise, check for the following:

step1.para: Low hydraulic fluid level in pump reservoir.
Leaks in hydraulic system components, plumbing, etc. Figure 85 and Figure HOTLNK> show cab lift cylinder and hose connections.
